title: Use to love it.
comment: First, the GOOD. This app is the best wallpaper changer app that I have found. Cycle multiple images on regular intervals, blur and dim images to help see icons on launcher, rotates images if launcher can support it, and handles images of different sizes. Now the BAD, this app use to show the whole image and would adjust scrolling depending on the image size in landscape but now it won't go to the edges. Also the double tap feature is broken on Smart Launcher. Although I think this is the Launcher's fault.

Muzei listens for COMMAND_TAP actions sent by the launcher to trigger double tapping - please ask your launcher of choice to send this event! http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/WallpaperManager.html#COMMAND_TAP

title: Simplistic Yet Awesome Live Wallpaper

The only customizations are applying a blur or dimming the image besides changing image sources or wallpaper update intervals. In addition to fetching images, predownloaded images can be used and shuffled. With a simple amount of settings and the ability to shuffle and get new images, high quality pictures are the center of this app.

title: Toggle blur on/off
comment: Overall I love this app, looks great, works smoothly, very simple. However, in some instances I would have liked a little more options for customization. For example, there isn't any way to select a folder for the "my photos" option, which is a bit of an inconvenience. In addition, I would love some options for controlling the double click "show original artwork" settings, i.e. double click to toggle blur and dim on and off, or at least some option to control the length of the unblur and undimming effects. Either way it's an amazing app and I would recommend it to everyone, but just changing these small things would make it above and beyond.

title: Simple and reliable
comment: Muzei (a name I can never remember for what it's worth)  does exactly one thing, and it does it well.   Similar to other wallpaper apps,  it pulls images from a remote source periodically and sets your device background. Optionally, the images can be rendered with a touch of Gaussian blur - just how much is up to you.   The best part of Muzei is its API. Extensions are easy to write and many exist already. I recommend checking out the Reddit extension to pull images from wallpaper subreddits.

PS: I'm also loving how the blur effect darkens out wallpapers too, to make DashClock lighter areas visible too. So good! Only thing that remains to be seen, is how much it affects battery life! Let's hope not!
